512: JOB DESCRIPTION Job Summary: Prepare samples and perform Quantitative Analysis testing in the laboratory using high throughput state-of-the art LC-MS/MS equipment. Clinical Laboratory Technician Job Duties: Perform sample prep procedures for LC/MS/MS assays. Maintain detailed records of tests performed and report laboratory test results. Enter Quality Control data, recognize Quality Control shifts and trends, and take appropriate action whenever necessary. Maintain records that demonstrate proficiency testing samples are treated appropriately and tested in the same manner as patient specimens. Communicate with support staff, clients and supervisors about procedural matters and problems in a timely manner. Perform maintenance on LC-MS/MS equipment, clean and sterilize laboratory equipment, glassware and instruments. Enter test results and data into computer/LIS system. Perform additional tasks as requested by laboratory management. Ability to multitask using different instruments. Provide assistance to other departments as needed. Requirements: Bachelor of Science Degree in Medical Technology, Chemistry, Biology or one of the natural sciences from an accredited institution. Minimum of 1 year hands-on experience in a laboratory using LC/MS/MS. Familiarity with high-throughput workflow environments. Comprehensive knowledge of professional medical technology/clinical laboratory science principles, practices, concepts, and theories providing for sound independent work. Comprehensive knowledge of laboratory quality control and assurance procedures and principles. General knowledge of laboratory equipment and ability to maintain, troubleshoot, and repair instrumentation. Ability to plan, organize, set priorities, and work as a team member and effectively complete assignments. Ability to use independent technical judgment to analyze and interpret laboratory results. Ability to read, interpret and apply complex written instructions. Ability to communicate, consult, and interact with other members of the team, external clients, and client service, and build positive and effective relationships. General computer skills, i.e. Microsoft Word, Excel, etc. Knowledge of SCIEX 4500 triple quadrupole systems Job Type: Full-time Pay: $28.00 - $34.00 per hour Schedule: 8 hour shift Monday to Friday Ability to commute/relocate: Union, NJ: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required) Education: Bachelor's (Required) Work Location: In person
